snippet: Three months ago, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo rolled out the Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption, with all of his familiar trumpets, drum rolls and rhetorical flourishes. Now, here come the exceptions.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column contends that New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo's Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption has been inconsistent and unduly deferential in the execution of its mission; notes that critics are worried that Cuomo has house-broken the commission and that it will present proposals that will trouble no one.
lead_paragraph: Three months ago, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo rolled out the Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption, with all of his familiar trumpets, drum rolls and rhetorical flourishes. Now, here come the exceptions.

headline.main: Governor’s Crusade Against Corruption Comes With Too Many Asterisks
headline.print_headline: Governor’s Crusade Against Corruption Comes With Too Many Asterisks

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
